page.title: 01NORTH WEST LONDON GAZETTEER
page.content: The Domesday block which we covered was in{North West London.}It included} Brondesbury Park,Cricklewood,Harlesden Willesden and Willesden Green.These were just small villages until the coming of the railways.They grew rapidly as people wanted to live in 'rural' areas and travel to work in Central London.Traditionally,the area has been a centre for Irish culture. This is still true but more recently the area has become more multiracial in nature.There have also been changes in employment but many of the deeper problems of unemployment have largely passed us by.Our account will focus on the following areas: {TRANSPORT }- Pages 1 to 5 {EMPLOYMENT }- Pages 6 to 7 {RECREATION }- Pages 8 to 12 {LIFE STYLES }- Pages 13 to 19 Editor's credits- Page 20
